opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Judgment affirmed.
Mr. Justice Barbieri took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: James T. Owens, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Green, Appellant.
Argued April 21, 1971.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
Samuel M. Lehrer, for appellant.
James T. Owens, Assistant District Attorney, with him Milton M. Stein, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
October 12, 1971:
